website_summaries.verdict: The Jaybird Vista is a nice, comfortable upgrade over the company's earlier models. But it's a tad too expensive in a true wireless headphone market where prices continue to drop.
pros: The Jaybird Vista buds fit securely
They're lightweight, comfortable and sound quite good
They're fully waterproof and come with a USB-C compact charging case
Battery life is decent at 6 hours, with 10 additional hours from the case
cons: There's no transparency mode to allow ambient sound in

customer_reviews.title: Mixed thoughts + update
customer_reviews.text: The headphones put out great sound. Fit, even with the smallest size is super snug, a little too tight and creates alot of pressure. My biggest complaint is the microphone which im told 10 times a day by people on the other end of a call that they cant hear me. This is a huge problem for me at least who needs these for that function as much as music. UPDATE: Consistent connectivity issues even with updated firmware. The microphone quality is still terrible. Would not recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: brett b.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: The right earbud stopped working within the first hour of use! Apparently it is a common issue not only with VISTA but also with RUN. Both soft and hard reset do not help! This is totally unacceptable for something that costs $175!!!
customer_reviews.author: MD MOHTESHAMUL HAQUE

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 day
customer_reviews.text: First off, they don’t last 6 hours outside the case. Maybe 4 hours. Second, they stopped connecting after just one day, so useless now. Third the volume is like 70% of every other headphone I’ve ever tried. However, I love the case and overall design. I also really like the way they feel taking them out of the case, the perfect fit in the ears and the snap when you place them back on the case. But they don’t connect anymore so...
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: I have returned two Jaybird Vistas
customer_reviews.text: The first pair the charging case began to disintegrate within the first week. The right earbud of the second pair would not charge; even after 48 hours. Update. Jaybird contacted me to "discuss" the issue; to no avail. I believe Jaybird spent too much time on the App and released this product too early.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and a great fit. These are some of the best earbuds that I’ve found. They have been able to survive me sweating and my normal day to day. I noticed a little bit ear fatigue but all in all a great pair of earbuds with a great sound profile.
customer_reviews.author: jason lewis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to lose
customer_reviews.text: Lost one bud on plane threw the whole unit out. Not buying something like this again. Too easy to lose. The "locator" is basically a gps based on your phone that will tell you where you're phone is.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good call quality for phone
customer_reviews.text: I like the personal eq setting they sound good there loud I would of gave 5 star but I’m going to tell you why the skip track button is only to forward a track not repeat that’s my only issue but other then that these are some of the best i heard I can actually compare these to Powerbeats pro there worth it
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a Christmas gift for my wife. Worked great for the first 2 months, then the volume would not work. Did a firmware update which seemed to take care of the problem. Now they will not charge past 40%. I have used a different charging case, cord and wall adapter to no avail. Chatted with Amazon, they were not helpful and stated the return window was closed. I was told to deal directly with JayBird. From now on I will cut Amazon out of my purchases and go directly to the manufacturer. They offered no support so they don't need my hard earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should have known better....
customer_reviews.text: I did not even bother turning them on. I thought the ear gel was going to be similar to the Bose type in that id did not have to be jammed into the ear canal. Well....they do. The only way to use these is to jam them wayh up into your skull. Feels like your head is going to explode with the amount of suction. Returning...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good quality headphone. App has an EQ where you can fine tune the sound. Pro: great sound, good bass, mids and high Good quality, good battery life, easy to connect to your phone, does a great job at cancelling out other noises. CON: and this is a big one, there are not enough variations of ear tips for fitment. They do not offer an accessory kit with more options. One tip would fall out with minor jostling, the next tip causes discomfort in the ear. I have taken to modifying on tip to see if it will work. I am not a runner but I do not feel that any version of the tips would be stable for running.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Beyond disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I own many pairs or wireless earbuds from the cheapest to the most expensive. Literally every one of them has paired instantly on the first try with my iphone. These simply will not connect. I’ve done everything the app and website say to do and have reset both the earbuds and my phone’s Bluetooth numerous times. Nothing. Could he the best performing ear buds ever, but apparently I will never know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Hardware failure
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for one day and they already have a hardware failure that's causing the right earbud to play significantly lower in volume than the left. I've spent an hour trying different resets and settings changes, i've cleaned them and changed the earpieces. Do yourself a favor and Google "jaybird right earbud volume issue" and see the number of people with this same issue. I wish I had. Do not buy these until this issue is resolved. Waste of money. Hell, the $30 earbuds I bought work better than this garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: AClarkson

customer_reviews.title: don't buy,unstable
customer_reviews.text: The favorite brand, but now very disappointing. Every year will buy new, support it progress, but only the price and error increase. This year did not use the first half of the problem, the update directly to the headset can not be used, angry directly back. In order to use it to buy a new phone) each brand has its masterpiece, which is your jaybird? I hope that you will be steady and steady, this year I will switch to another platform.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: sounds as good as Bose, but half the size and with usb c
customer_reviews.text: As I was waiting for bose to finally update the soundsport free wireless earbuds to something smaller and with USB C . my bose earbuds were stolen. Turns out the Jaybird vistas were the earbuds I was waiting for. They fit just like the bose, but better. The sound is very good, and the size is half of the bose soundsport free. I tried a more budget-minded brand and didn't like the sound quality. the moment I put these in and played a song I knew they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Luthersman

customer_reviews.title: Just Don't Work
customer_reviews.text: I have tried multiple factory resets and repairings and can confirm these are not a reliable product, despite the HEAVY marketing insisting otherwise. These stopped pairing on me a few days ago and there are simply no options to get them working again. Excellent example of a good company going bad. Don't buy these. They are no more waterproof or reliable than a $15 pair from China. Honestly, they are probably made in the same factory with less quality control because the warranty is made to lock you out of returning them easily, the customer support is non existent, and the marketing is designed to make you think them breaking is your fault.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Talesnik

customer_reviews.title: These things are the truth!
customer_reviews.text: Got these when my Soundcore Libery Neo's died after 2 months. Miles better right out of the box. Just a much more premium product and you really do get what you pay for. Sound quality is infinitely better. So much more bass. The EQ app is also really nice and can help you tune the earbuds to the way you want them to sound. The fit is also perfect for sports. I lift, run, and ride my bike in these and they do not budge.
customer_reviews.author: ryan curry

customer_reviews.title: A product that bricks itself with its own firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I just got them and they worked fine till I updated the headphones in the Jaybird app. The firmware bricks the headphones and according to what I've read on the internet the only solution is to buy new headphones and to not install the firmware. There's no indication of this problem anywhere on the product and the firmware is still on the app for some reason. This problem isn't isolated and has been around for months if you look online and Jaybird hasn't issued a fix. Jaybird is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serious Ear Tip Flaw
customer_reviews.text: These sound great and have the best app I've ever used. Why did Jaybird decide to go with a single eartip-wing design? Really? They assumed everyone that has larger ear canals have big ears and need large wing tips. I needed the large tip for best sound and seal but the wings are so large they are painful. Unfortunately there are no aftermarket options to compensate for this. It's a shame to return these due to the eartips. Sometimes engineers think too much without proper testing. They should have had separate eartip and wing options so you could mix and match for best fit like every other bud manufacturer on the planet.
customer_reviews.author: Davidd

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. Returned
customer_reviews.text: Returned these Jaybird Vista. Sound quality pretty good for music, but the microphone for when you're making phone calls was lousy had so many people tell me they couldn't hear me or was staticy and a lot of noise. Call customer support they said there was an update, I updated the software still no better. The charging case was it hit or miss you would have to wiggle them around to make sure they would make contact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and ultimately ended up buying these after initially thinking I wanted the Jabra Active Elite 75t and then returning them. Best features on the Jaybirds are: 1. Charging - lasts so long 2. Syncing with my phone - happens automatically, I don't have to press the scan button (had to with the Jabras) 3. Comfort and stability while running - love it 4. Can listen to one bud without the other - great for sharing music with my kiddos 5. $50 cheaper than the Jabras, the refund is like found money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but flawed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3 days ago and it keeps doing this but when I turn em on its fine but like 5 min into using it the right ear always stops playing music. The button works fine it's just literally no audio. I have to manually remove Bluetooth connection to em and manually reset them via the case. This does fix it as I'm 3 for 3 fixing this issue but it's super annoying so hopefully they can fix this in a software patch or maybe it's a hardware thing and they'll refund everyone with this issue as I've read it happens to a decent amount of ppl on other forums
customer_reviews.author: kevin suzuki

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable stable fit. Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to wear. Music sound is good but phone calls sound flat. The people at other end of conversation have trouble hearing me. Easily pairs to phone and other devices. A plus that you can use either right or left alone. Spares battery or when wants to hear environment as when listening to audio book. It nicely tells you battery strength when it goes from case to ear. Case easily goes in pocket. No way to tell amount of charge left in case until at the point that requires charging. Good battery life. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Anne Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I noticed some of the reviews were paid for/free product but I bought them anyway. They stick out less than the Bose wireless earbuds, which I liked. The app has the ability to control the sound. It's cool because I was having trouble hearing movies play using the normal setting. I've been using them 4x a week for about 8 hours a day. The battery lasts pretty long. The ear piece it was connected with it had the tip at the top. That hurt after a few hours so I switched it for the normal ones and it's still great. I recommend them. This is not a paid review nor was the product free. Just telling it how it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sports
customer_reviews.text: This are extremely comfortable, long battery life headphones. I am not an audiophile, so no commentary on sound quality beyond "sounds good to me". I wanted some long lasting earbuds I could wear while running/working out/working etc. I wears these a few hours each day with no ear discomfort. I charge the case about once every three days, and rarely run out of battery in my earbuds. I only wear one while I run/work, because with both in I can not hear my surroundings well. My husband has a pair too, and can't hear me talking to him when he has them in.
customer_reviews.author: H20 Doc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality, but left one won’t stay in my ear
customer_reviews.text: These headphones connect extremely instantly and sounds amazing. I love the app and the build quality is amazing. The only downside is that my left earbud won’t stay in my ear for some reason. The first 2 times I wore them there wasn’t an issue, but now I’m reaching up every couple minutes to adjust it, and once it straight up fell out. I wish they had a thing that went around my ear to avoid this problem, I don’t know what’s going on with it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Williams-Mele

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a SUBSTANTIAL upgrade from my other brand...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a different brand that rhymes with Cabbra Elite ACTIVE 65T. My biggest complaint with the others were they didn’t get loud enough for my taste and they dropped the Bluetooth connection CONSTANTLY. The Jaybird Vistas have completely eliminated both of these issues. I downloaded the app and customized the EQ to my taste and started rocking to old Iron Maiden while on the elliptical. The sound quality and volume is superior the others. The Bluetooth connection NEVER dropped a single time. These are a little pricey but in my opinion they are completely worth it because of what they deliver. I would recommend the Vistas and I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Realy good.
customer_reviews.text: This Product is amazing. It is expensive ($179) but the comfort, security and reliability pays for it. I been using this product every day for almost 12 hours(twice a day, approximate 8 hours earplugs battery life). The earplugs are so comfortable, is laud and the sound quality is amazing. After some month of use I have an issue with the right ear plug (it sound like half way sound), which I call the costumer services and I explain the issue. Costumer services say no problem we got you cover and they send a replacement for the right earbud. So in short, the product is expensive but is high quality that feels great and is back up for a year warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Cuan

customer_reviews.title: Sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Sounded bad till I upgraded the software. DL the app. The EQ SW is amazing. They sound great now. Wow. Decent bass and full range. Pricy but worth it. Love the case. Magnet close, USB c, big plus. Fiddle with the fit till you get secure and comfy. Update. They'll hurt my ears if I wear them for more than an hour. I dislike in the ear buds, I prefer earhooks and outside the ear - much more comfortable. I've tried several other brands and none come close to the sound quality of these. So I tolerate the minor pain in the ear for great performance.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: My running buddy
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy these because I wasn’t really sure if they would stay in my ears while running. I have small ear canals so the normal ear phones don’t really work well especially if I sweat. It keeps falling off my ears and I have to Keep pushing them in while I run. I love these so much now. I don’t have to worry about a cord and it’s all hands free. They don’t slip off either even if I sweat (I run daily). Why didn’t I buy these before? Sound quality is really good too. Good job Jaybird!!
customer_reviews.author: Minji

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic active use earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I have had these a month now and absolutely love them. I use them while being active, sports and yard work, and they stay in great. I really like everything about them including the battery life, the fit, the weight, and the audio quality. The pairing app lets you modify the EQ and I am really impressed with the sound. This is a case where you get what you pay for. I have had several cheaper ($40 range) versions which all suffered from short battery life, poor fit, and/or they didn't last very long. These earbuds feel very durable and I look forward to a lot of use from them.
customer_reviews.author: Tark

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch Buds!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best earbuds I have ever used. Everybody is different, of course, so ymmd, but these fit perfectly, which I have never encountered before. They're comfortable, have good battery life, and sound great. Also, they work well singly/individually, e.g. for phone calls, something I've had trouble with when using any of the several other earbud sets I've bought. NOTE: One mistake I made: These buds do NOT have active noise canceling! However, the fit is good enough to provide decent insulation from the surrounding environment. ANOTHER NOTE: I failed to specify that the buds also lack volume control, so that the user must depend on the music source device, e.g. mobile phone etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bluemoon

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I added one more star because they are the best company I know let me tell you why. I got my pair delivered and after a week I started having some problems with connectivity and thing. I talked to their team and in 2 days I had brand new Vistas at my doorstep. Like my customer satisfaction is above the roof!! One the side note this was my review before with 4 stars - They are worth it trust me but don't expect them to work as your wired headphones you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kx

customer_reviews.title: 7 months in, I'm NOT happy.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I've owned them about 7 months. The left one will no longer charge and I can't reset or fix it myself. I'll update on customer service when/if they respond. The really great feature about these earbuds is the water resistance. That's really the marketing behind them anyway. They're sleep and sound pretty good. Their battery life really is good. Their connection is just kind of crappy. It might be the pairing with my particular phone, but these guys have some pairing issues. It sometimes takes a couple of restarts to get them going. They always end up working, but they are infuriating to connect/stay connected at times.
customer_reviews.author: yepo

customer_reviews.title: The best wireless buds I've found
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different wireless earbuds, but none of them compare to the Jaybird Vista. The charging case fits comfortably in your pocket, the sound quality is high, and has enough noise cancellation to block out most outside sounds, but letting you hear enough of the environment so that you don't get hit by cars. I use mine almost everyday and they still perform very well. In case it helps others, after some experimentation I found that the Comply T-600 foam tips fit these well (
customer_reviews.author: Dan Van Tran

customer_reviews.title: They stay in your ear and sound GREAT.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy these for noise cancellation, so if you're interested in that aspect, read a different review. I love these because they STAY IN YOUR EARS! I like to do a lot of spinning and kicking when I work out, and I also do lots of box jumps and that sort of thing. Naturally, I wanted a pair of headphones that sould stay in my ear when I'm sweaty and also sound reasonably good. These stay in your ear, are waterprood, and sound amazing! If you're considering a few different pairs, skip those others. These are the ones you should get!
customer_reviews.author: Ben LaBerge

customer_reviews.title: Searched forever but finally found a great set of earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I started off w PowerBeats Pro and immediately returned them because they sounded like i was listening to music through a tin can. Sony WF-1000XM3 were initially a solution but kept falling out of my ears, weren't waterproof, and had the worst microphone for phone calls--captured everything except my voice; nearly impossible to have a conversation except in a quiet room. Finally found these Jaybirds. Still a bit of an issue with the microphone being sensitive to other sounds more than my voice, but other than that, perfect earbuds--amazing sound, comfy fit, discrete look, waterproof, small case, good battery life, and good noise canceling. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best earphones for runners
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best earphones I have owned. Most earbuds, especially those made by Apple, do not fit my ear very well. This one, with its wingtips fits my ear perfectly. However, be warned that it isolates almost all outside noises, so it may not be the best choice if you are running in a highly dense area, or an area that requires you to remain alert.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Great except for one issue (update:fixed now)
customer_reviews.text: I really loved my headphones but I have a really annoying issue that I noticed after a month of use, the left earbud is alot quieter than the right one. Otherwise they were stellar. Update: (Six months) Now they continually disconnect and reconnect every 5-10 minutes. It's extremely annoying. Update: (Seven months) I factory reset them and it fixed the connectivity issue. I was also able to fix disparity in loudness. Some ear gunk was lodged in the edge of the tiny speaker of my left bud. I rinsed it and gently ran a thin toothpick around the edge. It fixed it like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent sport buds with a near fatal flaw...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly nice buds for the price. Solid fit. Small. Decent EQ app. Small case with magnets well designed. Good exterior sound blocking (physical seal). Easy to pair. Good battery. BUT: the charging cord, USB-A to C is ONLY 10 inches LONG! C'mon Logitech, this does not even reach from a wall height mounted 115v/USB outlet to the desktop or floor height mounted USB to the floor. Should not have to buy a $10 3-5' accessory USB cord for a $150 (Amazon) product. Update after 3 weeks: fit well, battery life good and recharge in case ok. Sorta cranky when pairing with Fire 8. Does pair up but requires re-start half the time. Pairs fine with iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend / very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I based my purchase on reviews, but regret this purchase. While sound quality is clear with these wireless earbuds, the fit is horrible (although there are several options to adjust fit - none work for me), they do not stay in (as manufacturer claims) and when used for talking on the phone, the person I you are talking to hears everything around you amplified (ambient noises) and the wind is so loud (for example, when walking and using them for a call) you cannot be heard. Very dissatisfied because I can't use these and the cost was far more than they are worth.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Stewart, B.S., M.A.

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe wireless earbuds would deliver in the sound department the same way wired earphones do, but this bad boy changed my mind! I was truly blown away at how good the sound was. The noise cancellation is great too. Good battery life (around 6 hours) and they actually go in the ear canal instead of hanging outside the ear. I'll never go back to wires again!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: ‘Bird is the word!
customer_reviews.text: The Jaybird Vista earbuds are exceptionally well designed and extremely durable. I primarily use them when mountain biking. The Jaybirds absolutely stay in your ears (3 sizes included for best fit). I hammer down rocky trails and nothing but sweet music to my ears. Rainproof, sweatproof, dirtproof...the beat goes on. Very intelligent charging case. The only consideration is that these earbuds do not allow for ambient noise. If you want to hear your surroundings, just use one Jaybird Vista earbud.
customer_reviews.author: Research Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Best Top Quality/Expensive Buds on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Jaybird > Beats Powerbeats Pro/Airpods/Bose Soundsport I just got these and Beats Powerbeats Pro simultaneously, and the Jaybird vistas are better in every way for significantly less money. Not only is the sound quality better, and not only is the charging case actually pocket sized, but they're significantly more comfortable and in ear canal buds so they naturally block noise.
customer_reviews.author: Main Street reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for sports and working out, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: After going through 4 or 5 different brands I've finally settled on these as bing the best combination of sound, fit and battery life. The sound is some of the best i've heard in this category and they fit surprisingly well, even after working up a good sweat. Though they are not noise cancelling the noise isolation is VERY good.
customer_reviews.author: techracer

customer_reviews.title: Left bud stops working 6M in
customer_reviews.text: My vista's are subject to simple urban use i.e. 3 to 4 runs a week with no exposure to the elements except a little sweat, however my left bud stopped working in under 6 months = without it being exposed to any of the "earthproof" elements that the vistas are supposed to endure. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND !! (My $50 JBL headphones which are meant for media use have withstood harsher elements for over 2y+)
customer_reviews.author: Yogesh Nayak

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: I have no real complaints. I got what i paid for as advertised. The battery life is more than adequate, and the sound quality is great. This is my first pair of wireless headphones and i intended to use them in the gym. The first thing i did when i opened them was shake my head and jump around to see if they stayed in, and they did without even budging. I believe these are worth the money. As for noise cancelling, there is no active noise cancelling. However, they naturally block sound very well. i walked within 50 feet of a running helicopter today with them in and was comfortable. normally this condition would be absolutely painful.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for people with smaller eardrums
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for these and had to return it because all the 3 sizes of ear gel that it comes with does not fit. I followed their instructions and everything and it does not fit. They said I had to buy their memory type of ear gel, which is bullshit since I paid so much and none of their default ear gels stay in for more than 4 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have tried at least six types of true wireless earbuds, and I finally decided to pay the higher price in hopes to get the perfect ones. These were promising, and I liked that they are waterproof and that you can use one at a time. But I tried and tried with all of the optional eargels and they just would not stay in my ears. I gave them a couple of weeks, kept switching the eargels around but had to give up when they kept falling out at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: BagLadyPA

customer_reviews.title: great for outdoors activities but...not thebest option for indoor
customer_reviews.text: Pros - fits well in my small ears, especially due to fin supports. no stress at all. - case is compact, sleek and portable - sound quality is decent but not the best. custom equalizer is great though. - you can use each earbud independently. Cons - there is no hearthru function. - button controls not convenient. - no multipoint connection.which was the disappointment personally. that means when you connect to one device, the other device connected is automatically turned off
customer_reviews.author: Choe

customer_reviews.title: Fits snug
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple different ear buds. Really liked bose sounded awesome but sometimes if not closed in case rite they would not charge leaving me hanging when I wanted to workout . Then they just quit on me in the middle of a run think from sweating.. I tried mifo 0.5 version for under a 100 bucks they were ok. But not snug fit having to re adjust in middle of workouts. These Jaybirds are the real deal water proof from sweat. And talk about a locked in your ear fit just what I wanted. And the sound is awesome. You down load a app to go with your earbuds its awesome. Will definitely be staying with these .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for listening to audiobooks while kayaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earbuds for listening to audiobooks while kayaking. So far they have met all my expectations. I really appreciate the Jaybird app that works as an equalizer to adjust the loudness of individual frequencies--great if you have any hearing problems. The sound quality was fine for audio books. Haven't tried them for music. So far I've only gotten a few minor splashes on my earbuds but these splashes have not caused any adverse effects.
customer_reviews.author: Charlevoix

customer_reviews.title: Best pair I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these! They stick in my ears really well and don't fall out, and they sound so good! If you buy these you will definitely not regret it! Update: I've had these for close to 6months now and they are just as good as the day I bought them. These are a bit more expensive, but if you want a really solid pair of head phones for working out or just in general, these are it. These are the absolute best head phones I have ever purchased and I would purchase them again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase so far. They hardly ever fall out of my ears. They wick pretty well. I wish they had active noise cancellation along with passive since I go to some pretty obnoxious gyms. However, the passive noise cancelling that they provide is excellent and I can not imagine something better and blocks out the majority of all passive noise. I'm a bit critical of hearing gym music, and at about 80% volume, I don't hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Mdini87

customer_reviews.title: Great sound...great design
customer_reviews.text: Pretty impressive design and quality. Sound is incredible. Very high quality product. Have had Jaybird’s Bluebuds X and the 3, and Thea take it to the next level. Wasn’t sure I would like the ear plugs...since with the others I replaced them with foam Comfy’s, but these are really nice. Used large Previously , but the best fit is the mediums. Can keep them in till the batteries. Now, if I can not loose them or have my Newfy eat them....
customer_reviews.author: AlVacado

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones with a few small drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: These were great for working out, only one small issue. It kind of hurts to push the buttons on them because it pushes the whole earbud into your ear. I also found that the fin wing tip style of fitting isn't very comfortable for my ears. If neither of those bother you though, these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a few different earbuds and I really think these are my favorites. I have a slightly smaller ear canal so some brands are a little uncomfortable, but these are great, the most comfortable in-ear buds I have tried. The sound is clear and the app allows customization that I really like (example, I hold one ear bud to increase volume and the other to lower it). They're a bit pricey, but the quality justifies it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stowe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The Jaybird Vista are excellent wireless earbuds. After watching many YouTube videos it came down to these or the Beats. I ended up going with the Vista with its price point. The sound quality out of these earbuds are excellent. I currently use an iPhone X. The battery life will differ depending on your use. I typically use these ear buds for my runs. I usually run for an hour a day and I would go about 4 days before charging them back up. The carrying case is excellent! The form factor is small that it can fit in your pocket. I feel if you’re using these casually or for exercise, it will serve you well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works and Sounds as Expected
customer_reviews.text: The Jaybird Vista is an excellent product in the right direction and it delivers reliably in all departments and as expected. The only reason that I am giving it 4 stars only is because of the volume which can't go louder beyond a certain preset limit from the manufacturer. I hope that this is not a hardware limitation and a just software preset which they can fix in a future firmware update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my husband for Christmas. They started out great, he loved them. But they only lasted about 3 months before one earbud quit working completely. We’ve spent the last two months going back and forth with JBird trying to get them replaced, even after buying the added protection plan.
customer_reviews.author: Drawn this Way

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless earbuds for your money
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with my purchase. These are my first pair of wireless earbuds and I am not particularly someone that listens to music constantly. I use these for the gym and walking around my college campus. Overall these earbuds are lightweight and never fall out. The sound quality is amazing especially compared to airpods. I would say the only bad thing about these so far after three weeks of use is that they often connect to my phone so quick after taking them out of the case that I don't even recognize they are connected. Id highly recommend these for the price because you're really getting a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Thatcher Deyoe

customer_reviews.title: A couple of minor issues, but still overall AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing! Super comfortable, very stylish, and with amazing sound. Only gripe I have with them is that the options with the buttons are very limited.. and when they are in my ears and I dont have anything playing, they will turn off after a random amount of time (sometimes its after 5 minutes, sometimes after 2 minutes, sometimes after 45 seconds and sometimes they dont turn off at all unless I power them off manually or put them in the case. Other than that, I wouldnt trade these in for the world. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: So far i'm loving them
customer_reviews.text: Had them for a few days, so far I am loving them. Haven't had a full test of battery life from 100-0 but after 4 1/2 hours they were still at 40% of rather loud volume so I can't complain. Noise cancellation is amazing. The Jaybird app has an option to make a customizable EQ based on your hearing which made these sound quite good with little effort. In all, i'd recommend it if you have the extra money over any of the other similar items. I'll update again if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I am very Pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I Like the Fit. The Sound is everything but the midriff rattling bass of reality. The noise cancelling is impressive .. almost disconcerting. Battery Life.. with this tiny case.. psh.. Shirt test.. check.. They could only be better if they come with throwing knives.. Plus the warranty.. mmm.. (not the Best buy kind of warranty. The good kind)
customer_reviews.author: bekim taylor

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a pair of headphones that I can work out in!
customer_reviews.text: While I still prefer the Apple Air Pod Pro as an overall head phone, it falls out of my ear very easily. I have searched high and low for bluetooth headphones to work out with and have very little luck. The Vistas though, they seemed glued to my ear! Pairing was extremly easy and the Jaybird app is a nice touch. These are my new "go to" ear buds for working out. If you have had issues with ear buds staying in your ears during workouts, I would recommend giving these a try.
customer_reviews.author: diverbarrett

customer_reviews.title: I've had Jaybirds forever, and these are their best yet
customer_reviews.text: Sound great. Fit great. Awesome company and customer service. You can literally wear these in the shower. The battery lasts a VERY long time and the case has its own battery which will charge the headphones when not even plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua W.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful but not for me!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic part was too big for my ears and none of the buds sat in my ear canal at the right angle. they worked really well on Bluetooth and they never once disconnected. I did return due to them not fitting properly but I'm sure its just because i have a weird ear!
customer_reviews.author: Misaysay

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: These are nice headphones. Not amazing, but solid. They still find a way to fall out of my ears during runs. The sound quality is solid but not amazing. They work well for noise canceling and are water resistant which is cool.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird Vista
customer_reviews.text: While the headphones worked the sound quality was great, easy to set up but within 2 days buzzing started on one earbud. followed instructions to stop it and it happened a few more times. Being brand new and reading other reviews of this issue, I returned them as I don't want to deal with a known issue that keeps happening for the price these cost. too bad though they sounded great .
customer_reviews.author: RO

customer_reviews.title: After 6 mo, left earbud stopped working
customer_reviews.text: After only 6 months of use, the left earbud stopped producing consistent sound. It still pauses and plays. I tried the factory reset and it did not solve the issue. I take great care of my electronics, so a $160 pair of earbuds should last more than 6 months. I am very disappointment because I actually like these headphones overall. I gave 3 stars because I loved them when they worked.
customer_reviews.author: jsh

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for on-the-go noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as my wife's Christmas present from her wishlist. She really did get research and she got it right! These are really high quality earbuds. The earbuds fit snugly and the app is intuitive, allowing you to adjust the sound output. She uses these at the gym and has taken them on runs as well, but advises that you should be very aware of your surroundings due to the noise cancelling. For phone calls the mic does struggle a bit to pick up her voice, wouldn't replace a standard pair of headphones with a mic positioned near the mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Battery/Charging
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. I charge the earbuds for days and when I take them out of the case it tells me it is 10% charged. Then I put them back to charge more and the next time it says it is 100% charged. I used them for 5 minutes, put them back in the case and next time it says it is 50% charged. The earbuds are in the case which is plugged in getting charged the entire time. Very unhappy and I usually don't review products.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Good for running. Until they stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I use these buds for running, they stay put very well even with jumping. Sound quality is really good and I'm happy with my purchase) was my initial review after first week of using the bus. After maybe only a couple dozen gentle uses they have issues. The blue tooth disconnects after 30 seconds to a minute then takes several minutes to reconnect. This is very irritating while running, working out etc. Not to mention I paid nearly 160.00 for these ear buds. My cheap Amazon earphones have lasted longer. So frustrated now I cannot get assistance through Jaybird because I did not buy direct from them.
customer_reviews.author: nell

customer_reviews.title: The beautiful sound and in ear stability!
customer_reviews.text: The best set of earphone I’ve ever had. In my best audio opinion by far, this set is my favorite of all. The Durability is good as far as my experience with the set is concerned. I accidentally place the set, without the charging case, in my jacket and ran them through the clothes dryer for 20 minutes. They still worked and no warps or obvious effects resulted. Stays snugly in ear. I’ll buy again when needed. I highly recommend this in ear phone.
customer_reviews.author: Manaol Heat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The good: solid fit (never worry about them falling out), great sound (especially once you download the app), & they are waterproof! Love the compact case. It makes it easy to carry. Could be better: the battery life is impressive given its size, but I'd love it if they could get better. I also wish it had an ambient feature, so I wouldn't have to leave one out, or remove both of them completely to hear someone talk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too big of ear gels.
customer_reviews.text: Through testing many pairs of earbuds I have discovered that I apparently have small ear canals. I loved the sound of these headphones and they had all the features I was looking for. But even with the small size gels I couldn't wear them for more than 10 minutes. And to pull the right one out of my ear was literally difficult. I wish the ear fin and ear gel part were separated so they could offer more sizes of the in your ear part. The search continues..... :(
customer_reviews.author: spacebabes75

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my airpods and QC35ii
customer_reviews.text: After buying these, I've already sold my apple airpods 2, and I'm selling my Bose Quiet Comfort 35ii. The Jaybird Vista is: 1. comfortable 2. great sounding 3. blocks out most external sound 4. waterproof 5. great price compared to everything else
customer_reviews.author: Emory Erickson

customer_reviews.title: the left headphone stopped working. it’s a love hate thing
customer_reviews.text: do not buy. the left headphone stopped working after one week. when the vistas connect automatically great. but when they don’t connect automatically to iphones it’s a real pain in the butt. sometimes only one connects !?. the app sucks they never connect right away. i guess you get what you pay for but $180 is very steep and this headphones don’t work properly because they connect when they want to.
customer_reviews.author: Hannia & Mario

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but won't stay paired
customer_reviews.text: These are the only ear buds out of the many I have tried that: have reasonable sounds quality, stay securely in my ears even if I'm walking, and are comfortable. Now that I have used these for a while, I'll add that it is extremely difficult to get these to stay paired. They regularly become unpaired from my Pixel 2. When I try to re-pair them, I get a message that says the "pairing was rejected by Jaybird Vista". I regularly have to reset them and re-pair the earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: illusiondweller

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, poor single charge battery life
customer_reviews.text: Crushed as had to return. Great sound quality, base is amazing for ear buds. Excellent phone app. Unfortunately the battery life at 70% use lasted about 3.5h and no where the 6h advertised. Since I cycle, workout and walk everywhere with music that does not cut it for me. Yes, you can recharge by putting into small and convenient case however the one time charge battery life span is still poor. I used jaybirds in the past and was very happy however, this is a disappointment due to battery capacity during real life use (which is a shame)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird, you have a problem
customer_reviews.text: Right earbud died within a week of use. I tried all available troubleshooting methods multiple times without success and have already returned the product. Considering there are other folks reporting the same problem, it seems like there's a possible issue with this production run and Jaybird now knows it. Hopefully, they're taking care of it. I do still like the brand and may check back later, but for now, I'm going to stay away until they're worked this out. Unfortunately for my immediate needs, I'll have to go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for working out - crossfit, running, jump rope etc. The Good: - Excellent fit - Excellent audio - Sweat resistance - Battery life The 'Needs improvement' - I wish the app came with more presets. Must point out that the sound quality and fit are just awesome! I've loved other bluetooth headphones from JayBird as well - this one just tops the list. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nav3000

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: I finally made the switch from Beats. I am a Samsung user so obviously had no desire to get Airpods. I have little ears and one of my canals is even smaller so trying to find earbuds that fit I gabe up years ago. Knock on wood, this is my first day using them and ,makes me wonder why I waited so long. I'll be curious how good they are on the plane with noise .
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING TRUE WIRELESS AND GREAT SOUND!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a runner, exercise junky for 14 years and these are the best headphones I have ever owned! My previous sets were Bose and jaybird. My main complaint with my previous ones was that I could still here people talk next to me on the treadmill or gym music. With this Jaybird Vistas you cannot hear any outside noise. It fits perfectly in my ears and JUST AMAZING!!! You will not regret spending the money on these!
customer_reviews.author: sonbossie

customer_reviews.title: Its real simple what these need is a little bit more bass.
customer_reviews.text: I love to dance and sing even though I can't. If your looking to dance or sing these earbuds will definitely make you sing with the great clear sound but as far dancing well needs a little bit more bass but overall its great earbuds. It doesn't fall out your ear, its great for working out and its a slam dunk with sound. Its needs a little bit more noise isolation but if your looking for great loudness like real loud to the point your jamming then those sabbath e12 ultra and bose will save your life trust me I know. I'm trying out even more earbuds so I'll keep the community posted.
customer_reviews.author: Curry Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for active people
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of older Jaybirds and these are a definite step up in terms of both how they stay in place as well as comfort. No problems getting them set up and going. Great pair of earbuds if you are physically active.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: So far I love these. Sound quality is excellent, they fit in my ears and stay in place perfectly. Battery life and connectivity are excellent. Device controls are simple but work as they should. The app is a nice touch as well
customer_reviews.author: JAva

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, disappointed with connection
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these headphones, but just like both iterations of the Runs then Bluetooth connection is garbage when I use these to workout. I can’t get a solid connection even holding my phone at shoulder level. Why haven’t these issues been resolved??? There’s no way there is Bluetooth 5.0 on these when the tarah pros have a better connection and Bluetooth 5.0. So disappointing, but at least they nailed the fit and sound great. I’ll be returning these, just like the runs.
customer_reviews.author: Cheney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones! A must have!
customer_reviews.text: What I always loved about Jaybirds is that you can adjust the sound to how you want to hear your music! This is my second pair in how many years because I wanted earbuds and these stay right in the ear and total noise cancellation! . When I'm with my kid I use one ear bud to hear music so I can hear out for him as the other ear bud charges in the case. They last a long time, I had them since January and since I only use them for traveling to and from work, TV and walks I've only had to put the case to charge like twice a month. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ashenefe and Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These were everything I hoped them to be. They fit nicely in the ear, have a wonderful sound quality, and have a nice battery life. The included carrying case, which acts as a re-charger, is a nice touch and quite handy. The surrounding noise is blocked out fairly well (I didn't want it completely gone so as to be aware of sudden situation around me) and was more than satisfying. It's a nice pair of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Tonja Drecker

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the perfect earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: Wholy cow, jaybird earbuds are amazing. Almost nothing stays in my ears, i have tried many ear buds expensive to cheap nothing really worked. But these wholy cow, stays in your like locked wih master lock. The sound,quality and app to customize is amazing. This eards for folks who like work out just keep that in mind. You cant go wrong with product.
customer_reviews.author: mongol

customer_reviews.title: Sweatproof but not Slip-proof
customer_reviews.text: Jaybird makes great waterproof bluetooth headphones. However, these would not stay in my ears at all. I tried every fit, but no avail. I’ve owned previous versions of Jaybirds, and had to buy the comply foam buds in order for them to stay put. Unfortunately, comply does not make foam buds for these Jaybirds. If your ears sweat at all, the standard plastic Jaybird buds will start to slip after some time, no matter what size tips you use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and a must buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about getting totally wireless headphones. I was always nervous that they would keep falling out and/or not sit in my ears correctly. I own the X4's from jaybird and love those. After much thought, debate and youtube review videos; I figured I would give these a shot. I am not disappointed in the slightest. I run, lift and so extensive Kettle bell workouts as well as almost any kind of HIIT. These stay put! hurry up and buy them! Plus- they sound nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Kramer

customer_reviews.title: The best buds ever
customer_reviews.text: I have always had problems with ear buds falling out while I ran. In the past, I would have to wear a head band over to get other buds to stay. Not so with these Jaybirds! These Jaybirds fit in perfect and the tab that tucks under the ear is really sturdy and stiff, and these things stay in place even when I am sprinting! No head band needed! On top of that, the sound quality and the EQ control with the app, is AMAZING. Super deep Rich bass, and clear highs! I had no idea an ear bud could deliver this high quality of sound. These J-birds are worth every penny in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and died within half a year
customer_reviews.text: Product died within four months of usage. While it lasted, it did not have particularly better sound quality than a 20 dollar bluetooth earbud, nor did it cancel noise better or fit securely. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SobeMurica

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've tried multiple true wireless earbuds and I like these i haven't had any issues yet hopefully it stays that way, i don't like the case because I have to guess if my headphones or charging because the case has an indication light but the headphones don't so you won't be able to see if they are charging, that's the only draw back I have. But they are perfect for the gym no problems staying in my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Petite-Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Best product in 180$ price range.
customer_reviews.text: pros - very good connection with the mobile because of 5.0 Bluetooth ( very long distance ) - good battery life. - very clear sound ( no flickering ) - can use each earbuds individually ( regardless of left or right ) - good app. - has find my earbuds feature. - water proof IPX7 Cons - Less Bass
customer_reviews.author: JAY R

customer_reviews.title: Case won’t charge!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a common problem with the Vistas from what I’ve read on the support boards. The charging case LED won’t light up anymore and won’t charge the earbuds. They’re basically useless to me now. Working with Jaybird to hopefully get a replacement case. Also, I got a lot of Bluetooth interference at the gym when the gym was crowded. The sound would cut in and out which made listening very annoying. I’m pairing them to an iPhone 11. I recently purchased Apple’s earbud pros and haven’t had the interference issue. The sound quality on the Vistas is good but I do not recommend them due to the case not charging and the Bluetooth connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the predecessors
customer_reviews.text: After an absolute disaster of Run/RunXT, i didn't expect much from headset, but I decided to take the shot, and ended up getting these anyway. Honestly, can't complain. The sound is very good, battery life lasts more than enough (with the case), they don't fall out of my ear even at the gym. One complaint is that sometimes the case would refuse to connect to your device, if the light starts blinking red from low battery, even if the headphones themselves are fully charged
customer_reviews.author: Ivan S.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I wish I should have read the negative or 1 star reviews about these wireless EarPods before ordering these. They are not only expensive but they not connect to the Bluetooth easily for your iphone but if they connect randomly then the left side EarPod doesn’t work. Total piece of garage and I just returned them after 1 day
customer_reviews.author: Varinderjit Thind

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I looked for wireless earbuds for months. I reviewed quite a few. These are great. They fit in my ear like they were made to. The sound quality is better than anything I've used in the past. They fit right back into their case and charge right back up. The curvature of the earbud locks into your ear and won't fall out. You will not be disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

product_meta.title: Jaybird Vista True Wireless Bluetooth Sport Waterproof Earbud Premium Headphones - Nimbus Gray
product_meta.description: Color:Nimbus GrayFeeling the flow, lost in the moment, in the zone—whatever you call that Place that lies beyond limits, we built Vista to help you go, but never go quiet. Vista, along with its always-ready, stashable charging case, offers an unparalleled battery life, Premium sound quality and an earth-proof IPX7 construction that allows you to weather any workout. The lightest, most compact, and most advanced headphones we've ever made feature industry-leading battery life and #EARTHPROOF shock, dust, water, and sweat-resistant IPX7 construction. Vista expands the horizon of your active audio experience.
feature_bullets: EARTHPROOF: Fully waterproof crushproof dropproof and sweatproof IPX7 construction ensures Vista can withstand any workout running or weather conditions (Meets MIL-SPEC STD810G standards)

ALWAYS READY: Vista gives you 6 hours of audio on a full charge plus 10 more in the compact charging case for 16 hours of total charge and 32 hours If using one bud alone A 5-minute quick charge offering an hour of playtime

CONNECTED: Vista’s cutting-edge JBS1 true wireless bluetooth technology ensures high quality zero-lag stereo sound for music and calls and a reliable connection that pairs easily with your phone every time
GO LIGHT: Vista’s earbuds are among the smallest and lightest premium headphones on the market meaning that you’ll literally forget you’re wearing them
LOCKED IN: Three sizes of interchangeable ear gels ensure a secure ultra-comfortable fit that feels weightless while you stay active
FIND YOUR FLOW: The Jaybird iOS and Android app gives you infinite EQ control over Vista’s highly efficient 6mm drivers for an unmatched custom audio experience
STASH IT: The compact low-profile charging case makes carrying and charging Vista effortless
FIND MY BUDS: Keep track of your wireless earbuds through the Jaybird app

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,012 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
